result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Charles Rinde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin Charles Rinde is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin Charles Rinde was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge R. Michael Waterman January 11, 2017 - Amend JOC to reflect $660.00 restitution on 16CF549 to be paid during the period of Probation.

Court dismisses Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5.
Defendant to report to Probation September 15, 2016 by 3:00 p.m.
Court notes 22 days credit against any ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF543.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF543.

-Defendant to complete MRT.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defenant to submit a DNA sample.
-Letter of apology to Deputy Justin Johnson wihtin the next 20 days.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to obtain his HS Diploma.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Random and regular testing.
-Any other treatment recommended by Agent.
-Maintain employment.
-Cognitive treatment.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-All costs to be converted into a civil judgment.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont DF: Kevin Charles Rinde appeared from jail. Case called at 1:10. Court reviews charges and penalties. DE has two other cases in Branch 2 where sentencing is scheduled tomorrow. DA Nieskes makes sentencing argument. Atty. Stormont makes sentencing argument. Court orders: On Ct. 1
3 years  6 months total confinement
1 year 6 months initial confinement
2 years ES with conditions:

- Random and regular testing.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- AODA and any recommended follow through. 
- Any other treatment recommended by the agent. 
- Employment
- Cognitive treatment.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.

All costs will be converted to a civil judgment. 
Court notes 144 days credit.   

DE is remanded.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF: Kevin Charles Rinde appeared. Case called at 4:05. Atty. Repka updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 15CF543 dismissing the enhancer . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF543 dismissing the enhancer. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2-5 in 15CF543. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H 
18 months probation with conditions:
 Court notes 22 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 
- DE to complete AODA and any recommended follow through
- DE to complete MRT
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Costs of $268.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.
- Letter of apology to Deputy Justin Johnson within the next 20 days.
- Random and regular testing.
- DE to get HS diploma. 

 DE to report tomorrow by 3:00pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on August 10, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Arraignment at 12-08-2015 04:15 pm

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Katrinia R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Edward Minser  DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Kevin Charles Rinde appeared from jail. Case called at 9:04. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty. Repka requests a bond modification.  Arraignment scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
